title: Pacific Engagement visa (subclass 192)Pacific Engagement
summary: This page provides information about the Pacific Engagement visa (subclass 192), which allows eligible nationals of Pacific Island countries, Timor-Leste, and Tuvalu to live and work in Australia permanently. It explains the two streams of the visa and provides key dates for the 2025–26 ballot periods.

structured_data.description: A permanent visa allowing people of Pacific Island countries and Timor-Leste to live and work in Australia.

streams.description: Known as the ‘Pacific Engagement visa’, this stream is for eligible Pacific Island and Timor-Leste nationals.
This stream is for Tuvaluan nationals only and implements Australia’s obligations under the Australia‑Tuvalu Falepili Union treaty.

key_points: From 1 May 2025, the Pacific Engagement visa (subclass 192) consists of two streams: the Pacific Engagement stream and the Treaty stream.
Ballots for the 2025–26 period are specific to each visa stream.
important_dates: 1 May 2025 – Introduction of two separate visa streams
25 August 2025 – Pacific Engagement stream ballot closed
